*~*Elissa Jill*~*

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Censorship and unschooling cannot  existtogether!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/6/2003 2:40:14 PM Central Standard Time, ... I think if he came back he d be different, because a lot of us met him in SC and I don t
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/6/2003 2:40:14 PM Central Standard Time,
ecsamhill@... writes:

> If Ned came back to this list, I would just auto-delete him. Which I'm
> sure is preferable to me getting really pissed and screaming at him.
>

I think if he came back he'd be different, because a lot of us met him in SC
and I don't think he could keep being a pain towards people he actually
*knew*.

But maybe I underestimate him. ;)

Tuck


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Censorship and unschooling cannot  existtogether!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/6/03 2:46:10 PM, grlynbl@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/6/03 2:46:10 PM, grlynbl@... writes:

<< EXCELLENT idea. And I feel that is what folks should do if they dont
like
what someone is saying. Everyone's email has some sort of block or ignore
function. Too much gobbledygook mail that is annoying, just block the
sender. That leaves the decision up to each member as to how they want to
deal with others posts. Again, I dont know exactly what went on, but it
seems to me, that if one has nobody to argue with, they would eventually stop
posting. I would assume there had to be some fuel to the fire for Ned to
continue posting. Would he just keep posting to "deaf ears"? Hmmm, well,
he might.. lol.. but if he was blocked, how would you know? >>

This isn't about unschooling.
There are places to go to read Ned's views if you're interested.
Not everyone's e-mail programs can block.

<<Too much gobbledygook mail that is annoying, just block the
sender. >>

It's easier for me to ask you to save your opinions for things you really
know about than for some part of 1000 people to try to figure out how to
block.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Censorship and unschooling cannot  existtogether!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/6/03 3:39:56 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... EXCELLENT idea.   And I feel that is what folks should do if they dont like what someone is
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/6/03 3:39:56 PM Eastern Standard Time,
ecsamhill@... writes:

> If Ned came back to this list, I would just auto-delete him. Which I'm
> sure is preferable to me getting really pissed and screaming at him.
>

EXCELLENT idea. And I feel that is what folks should do if they dont like
what someone is saying. Everyone's email has some sort of block or ignore
function. Too much gobbledygook mail that is annoying, just block the
sender. That leaves the decision up to each member as to how they want to
deal with others posts. Again, I dont know exactly what went on, but it
seems to me, that if one has nobody to argue with, they would eventually stop
posting. I would assume there had to be some fuel to the fire for Ned to
continue posting. Would he just keep posting to "deaf ears"? Hmmm, well,
he might.. lol.. but if he was blocked, how would you know?

Teresa
